Check out was as complete coverage of the FIFA World Cup Brazil through the World Cup Central. Featured subjects of the crown and complete coverage of the games of the Brazilian team.

CENTRAL WORLD CUP - Cup Central is a sports program that covers events related to Brazilian and World Cup 2014 squad.

2014 World Cup

The Central Cup back in 2014 to analyze the 64 matches of the Brazil World. Alex Escobar, Caio Ribeiro Thiago Leifert and presented the program, beyond the audience of 50 people, received guests such as actor Marcius Melhem.

In 2014, the Central Cup innovated. Used a tactic table and a virtual field to analyze team performance and Scolari of Brazil's opponents. The background scenery was also a novelty because it changed depending on the stages where Brazil played.

Originally, the Central Cup was part of special programming developed by TV Globo for the World Cup in South Africa in 2010. Program aired everyday in three editions, about 25 minutes. In the morning, Luis Ernesto Lacombe presented the results and analyzed the games 8:30 and 11am. In the afternoon, after the Video Show, Tiago Leifert updated the news and talked about matches of 15h. The presenter returned in the evening edition, which went on air before the Journal of the globe, with a summary of the day at the World Cup.

On match days in Brazil, the evening edition of Central had an hour long, with more detailed analysis of the best moments of the match, special reports on the games and the participation of viewers over the Internet.

On Sundays, the Central Cup earned a special edition, which went on air before DomingÃƒÂ£o FaustÃƒÂ£o, with a weekly summary of the World Cup, attended the commentator Caio Ribeiro and an audience comprised of fans, Brazilians and foreigners, and special guests.

After the World Cup in South Africa, on August 10, 2010, the Central Cup returned to the lineup Rede Globo, after Brazil's victory over the United States by 2 x 0, first friendly of Brazil squad under the command 's coach Mano Menezes. In the studio, Tiago Leifert and Caio Ribeiro discussed the main moves.

Since his return to the grid, the Center became always displayed on match days the Selection and possibly in special editions. On November 20, 2011, the show aired after the Today newspaper, in a ceremony broadcast of FIFA in Zurich, Switzerland Tiago Leifert, Caio Ribeiro, Carlos Casagrande and guests commented on the event, announced that Sao Paulo as the city that will receive the opening game of the 2014 World Cup and the match schedule of the 2013 Confederations Cup in Brazil.

On some occasions, journalists Alex Escobar and Tino Marcos has also presented the program, replacing Tiago Leifert.


In a studio in Rio de Janeiro equipped with four HD cameras and two interactive multi touch screens, touch screens (one with five square meters), the presenter calls Tiago Leifert links and reports and interacts with the commentator Caio Ribeiro and a small audience formed by fans and guests of the program.

A striking feature of the World Cup Central is using the internet as a communication tool throughout the program. The presenter uses a computer with touch screen commands to access blogs, social networks, tables, maps, results, stats and videos.


Kyojuu Yamashi. 21/07/2014. World Cup FIFA Brasil 2014.
